intro: Biscutella guillonii, commonly known as the Guillon's biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Biscutella guillonii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
